Steve,
 
Thanks for catching this. The "punning" use of classes as suites is an
implementation detail, not essential to the model. The next time we look at
the API we'll think about how to represent and name the concept differently.
 
Cheers,
 
Kent

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Steve Freeman
Sent: Wednesday, September 17, 2008 12:46 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Before/After



One small point which just struck me is that @Before/AfterClass is 
named after an implementation detail, not the domain. It really ought 
to be @Before/After Suite

S.

Steve Freeman
http://www.mockobje <http://www.mockobjects.com> cts.com
